name: libxinerama
description: libXinerama - API for Xinerama extension to X11 Protocol.

dependencies.name: libx11
dependencies.description: libX11 - Core X11 protocol client library.

dependencies.name: libxext
dependencies.description: libXext - library for common extensions to the X11 protocol.

dependencies.name: xineramaproto
dependencies.description:
X Xinerama Extension. This is an X extension that allows multiple
physical screens controlled by a single X server to appear as a single
screen.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and
libraries

dependencies.name: util-macros
dependencies.description:
This is a set of autoconf macros used by the configure.ac scripts in
other Xorg modular packages, and is needed to generate new versions of
their configure scripts with autoconf.

dependent_to.name: fakexrandr
dependent_to.description:
This is a tool to cheat an X11 server to believe that there are more
monitors than there actually are.

dependent_to.name: feh
dependent_to.description:
feh is an X11 image viewer aimed mostly at console users. Unlike most
other viewers, it does not have a fancy GUI, but simply displays images.
It is controlled via commandline arguments and configurable key/mouse
actions.

dependent_to.name: xinput
dependent_to.description: xinput is a utility to configure and test XInput devices.

dependent_to.name: opensubdiv
dependent_to.description:
OpenSubdiv is a set of open source libraries that implement high
performance subdivision surface (subdiv) evaluation on massively
parallel CPU and GPU architectures. This code path is optimized for
drawing deforming surfaces with static topology at interactive
framerates.

dependent_to.name: compiz
dependent_to.description:
compiz - OpenGL window and compositing manager. Compiz is an OpenGL
compositing manager that use GLX_EXT_texture_from_pixmap for binding
redirected top-level windows to texture objects. It has a flexible plug-
in system and it is designed to run well on most graphics hardware.

dependent_to.name: gdl
dependent_to.description:
A free and open-source IDL/PV-WAVE compiler. GNU Data Language (GDL) is
a free/libre/open source incremental compiler compatible with IDL and to
some extent with PV-WAVE.

dependent_to.name: openscenegraph
dependent_to.description:
OpenSceneGraph is an open source, high performance 3D graphics toolkit
that's used in a variety of visual simulation applications.

dependent_to.name: kitty
dependent_to.description: fast, featureful, cross-platform, GPU-based terminal emulator

dependent_to.name: xdotool
dependent_to.description: fake keyboard/mouse input, window management, and more

dependent_to.name: glfw
dependent_to.description:
GLFW is an Open Source, multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES and
Vulkan development on the desktop. It provides a simple API for creating
windows, contexts and surfaces, receiving input and events.

dependent_to.name: icedtea
dependent_to.description:
The IcedTea project provides a harness to build the source code from
http://openjdk.java.net using Free Software build tools and adds a
number of key features to the upstream OpenJDK codebase. IcedTea
requires an existing IcedTea or OpenJDK install to build.

dependent_to.name: libcanberra
dependent_to.description:
libcanberra is an implementation of the XDG Sound Theme and Name
Specifications, for generating event sounds on free desktops, such as
GNOME.

dependent_to.name: xterm
dependent_to.description:
The xterm program is a terminal emulator for the X Window System. It
provides DEC VT102 and Tektronix 4014 compatible terminals for programs
that can't use the window system directly.

dependent_to.name: vmd
dependent_to.description:
VMD provides user-editable materials which can be applied to molecular
geometry. These material properties control the details of how VMD
shades the molecular geometry, and how transparent or opaque the
displayed molecular geometry is. With this feature, one can easily
create nice looking transparent surfaces which allow inner structural
details to be seen within a large molecular structure. The material
controls can be particularly helpful when rendering molecular scenes
using external ray tracers, each of which typically differ slightly.

dependent_to.name: dia
dependent_to.description: Dia is a program for drawing structured diagrams.
